sections.snippet:
Child views are sub-views that are tied to a parent. Their lifecycle methods are coordinated so that children are rendered after the parent has rendered (to ensure that the DOM is ready), and they are destroyed when their parents are destroyed.

Typically, the directory structure mimics the parent-child relationship, so it would look something like this:

    + ParentView
        + ChildView
            - view.js
            - options.js
            - model.js
            - template.html
        - view.js
        - options.js
        - model.js
        - template.html

Child views should be stored at the root view level if they are shared between multiple views.
